tit.e: Niedono (institution for storage of offering foods)
Niedono (institution for storage of offering foods)

sen.j: 贄殿（にえどの）は、日本の律令制において内膳司に付属した機関。
sen.e: Niedono was an institution attached to Naizenshi (Imperial Table Office) under the Ritsuryo system of Ritsuryo Japan.
Niedono was an institution attached to Naizenshi (Imperial Table Office) under the Ritsuryo system of Ritsuryo Japan.
Niedono was an institution attached to Naizenshi (Imperial Table Office) under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) of Ritsuryo Japan.
sen.cmt: ウェブに合わせ原文を修正し、用語集に合わせました。

sen.e: This was Ryoge no kan (class outside of the Ritsuryo system).
This was Ryoge no kan (class outside of the Ritsuryo system).
This was Ryoge no kan (class outside of the Ritsuryo system).

sen.j: 贄殿は諸国から贄（天皇家に進献する食物）として上納された各地の特産物を保管・管理する。
sen.e: Niedono stored and managed local specialties of each region presented to the emperor from provinces as nie (foods presented to the emperor).
Niedono stored and managed local specialties of each region presented to the emperor from provinces as nie (foods presented to the emperor).
Niedono stored and managed local specialties of each region presented to the emperor from provinces as nie (foods presented to the emperor).

sen.j: 職員として別当や預がいた。
sen.e: Betto (the superintendent) and azukari (an additional post to the chief of Naizenshi) worked as officials.
Betto (the superintendent) and azukari (an additional post to the chief of Naizenshi) worked as officials.
Betto (the superintendent) and azukari (an additional post to the chief of Naizenshi) worked as the officials.
